Have any of you ever heard about a regiment known as the South Irish Horse
Yes. Someone on Picarto mentioned it a few minutes ago.
I wish I had a sense of humour like yours...or my sisters..or my father's...
But anyhow, they're an actually rather unknown regiment, who fought during World War 1.
My father did a lot of research on them.
They were an Irish Cavalry regiment.
Not much information is given about them in most books.
So my father decided that their story needed to be told.
And I'm reading the book right now.
:ctwokinds-power: holy empowered Nibbly, that new Magical Mishaps page looks awesome!
Fun fact: This page is actually where the :ctwokinds-power: emote's base came from.
I need to go to bed.
I always have to go just as the chat's warming up.
But there you go. Sleep IS important, isn't it?
And besides, I've got my Raine print on my bedside table.
I found a nice frame for it over the Christmas.
Oh my god its actually happening to nibbly

Here’s another thing to think about - scorpions are spiders + lobsters + nightmau
Did a deep clean of my Mister’s cage today....I made progress. He poo in the bathroom...haven’t managed to make him go to the toilet yet
Should be able to go at 10. Breads done so all we’s got is close stuff
Provided the church crowd is low
Had a lot of private religious academies today. Ironically had to patiently sit through a nun lecturing me about the trials of Job.
Private religious schools in an upper crust area.
Did you learn from the nun?
Not really, read the bible a few times. But the nun ~insisted~ I stay and learn with the students for "just a moment".
Hey your soul can still be saved
Used to be Jewish. I got better.
If I were to ever follow a dogma again I think, it'd have to be Buddhism.
But alas. I am content being a listless heathen.
seems like a fairly chill dogma
Yeah, the eight-fold path is a pretty legit ideology.
Holy shitballs. Looking up my route for tomorrow. First two deliveries is gonna be over 100 miles.
No single day on the job thus far has been more than 90 miles.
That 112 mile stretch is just going to be my first two hours or so.
Then luckily everything after that is within about 15 miles of each other.
Fortunately, I make bonus money by the mile. Not a ton, but it covers gas and then some.
Just learned some illustrator basics...like shortcuts and stuff. Be making the digital arts in no time. :ctwokinds-soon:
Yeah, I'm working as a courier for the company my sister works at.
Mostly easy work. Just have to deliver a few thousand flyers to a buncha schools around the state.
Some poor sod has to go all the way to Yuma, (essentially Mexico/California)
I hate to drive, so that'd definitely not be a job for me.
Put the cruise control on 75, load a couple CD's, and jam out all the way there.
Unless youre bad at driving like me
Then you spend the whole time anxious~
Free money as far as I'm concerned.
... I feel like I should know this, but what side of the street is the side you drive on in NZ? I know AUS is on the left.
But we are both still colonies of the glorious british empire, so the left as well
Canada is still a part of the UK and they drive on the right though.
At least they still recognize the Queen I think.
Imagine the disaster americans driving into canada or vice versa would have though :thinking:
Nah, Canadians tend to live with us though.
I do love me some Canadian money though.
its like pink and purple right?
Every winter they migrate down here and give us all their money.
Only time my French education ever came in handy. Working with the French Canadians.
Alas, they drive like shit. So that does kinda suck.
"Speed limit is 65 and the flow is going at 80? Better hog the fast lane and do 50!"
That does fit with their "relaxed" image
Aaand that fits with the american image
It's a way of life here.
Gotta go F A S T :race_car:
Specifically in central AZ. We used to have speed cameras on the freeways. But they eventually got taken down.
Literally everyone was getting tickets for speeding, but no one was paying.
Then one of their maintenance people got shot in a drive-by.
So they decided it was just better to let folks do whatever on the freeways.
They're still on the surface streets though. So there the limits are actually enforced.
But the freeways are kinda whatever. So long as you're not driving like an asshole you're good to go.
Best story I have was getting a warning for doing 120.
193 kph for you non-freedom units folks.
It was 4 in the morning and it was my older brother and I going out paintballing. The cop just let us go saying to slow it down, and wishing he could go with us.
Its more dangerous to try stop the drivers so the cops dont try

Nah, there are still cops and sheriffs. And they'll pull you over for being too aggressive. But traffic just generally flows at around 75-85. Normally that's a hefty ticket in other parts of the states.
If the cops have to fill a ticket quota do they just pull over random people?
ticket quotas are a myth. Jsut sayin'.
And no, there are still plenty of assholes doing asshole things getting pulled over.
Doing 80 is fine. Doing 80 while dodging between multiple lanes of traffic is fine-able.
What if you do it while blasting eurobeat
eurobeat alone is a jailable offense.
Or at least I hope it is.
I've been in this place before~ :notes:
And with that. I need to head to bed. Gotta get up early for a long drive tomorrow lol.
Likely accompanied by Pink Floyd, Metallica, and Tool.
I'll see you down in Arizona Bay.
